title: Input schema for Smart article extractor

startUrls.title: Category URLs
startUrls.description: Can be main page URL or any category URLs. Article pages are found and enqueued from these. If you want direct article URLs, use `articleUrls` input instead

articleUrls.title: Article URLs
articleUrls.description: Direct URLs to the articles to be parsed. No extra pages are enqueued from article pages.

onlyNewArticles.title: Only new articles
onlyNewArticles.description: If true, will scrape only new articles each you run it. All URLs you scraped are saved in dataset called `articles-state` and are compared with new ones.

onlyInsideArticles.title: Only inside domain articles
onlyInsideArticles.description: If true, will scrape only articles that are on the domain from where they are linked.

saveHtml.title: Save full HTML
saveHtml.description: Saves full HTML of the article page but makes data less readable.

useGoogleBotHeaders.title: Use Google Bot headers
useGoogleBotHeaders.description: This option will allow you to bypass protection and/or paywall on some sites. Use with caution as it might get blocked.

minWords.title: Minumum words
minWords.description: Article need to contain at least this amount of words to be extracted
minWords.sectionDescription: These settings tell the actor what articles should be scraped. Leaving default values usually works fine.

dateFrom.title: Date from
dateFrom.description: Only articles from this day to present will be scraped. If empty, all articles will be scraped. Format is YYYY-MM-DD, e.g. 2019-12-31, or Number type e.g. 1 week or 20 days

mustHaveDate.title: Must have date
mustHaveDate.description: If checked, the article must have a date of release to be considered valid.

isUrlArticleDefinition.title: Is URL article?
isUrlArticleDefinition.description: JSON settings of what considered a link to an article. If any of them is true, then the link will be opened.

pseudoUrls.title: Pseudo URLs
pseudoUrls.description: Can be used to enqueue more pages like pagination or categories. Doesn't work for articles, they are recognized by the recognition system.
pseudoUrls.sectionDescription: Use these settings to enqueue more pages. If you want to enqueue direct article URLs this way, you have to add `{ "label": "article"}` to the userData`

linkSelector.title: Link selector
linkSelector.description: You can limit <a> tags whose links will be enqueued. By default this is empty, add `a.some-class` to enable it

maxDepth.title: Max depth
maxDepth.description: Maximum depth of crawling. 0 is only start URLs, 1 are first level links etc. Only valid for pseudo URLs

maxPagesPerCrawl.title: Max pages per crawl
maxPagesPerCrawl.description: Maximum number of total pages crawled. Includes home page, pagination pages, invalid articles etc.

maxArticlesPerCrawl.title: Max articles per crawl
maxArticlesPerCrawl.description: Maximum number of valid articles scraped. The crawler will stop automatically after reaching this number.

maxConcurrency.title: Max concurrency
maxConcurrency.description: You can limit the speed of the scraper. Don't forget to lower your memory too to save Compute units.

extendOutputFunction.title: Extend output function
extendOutputFunction.description: A function that allows you to merge your custom extraction with the default one. You have to return an object from this function. This object will be merged/overwrite the default output for each article.
extendOutputFunction.sectionDescription: This is only needed if the default output is not good enough for you. Be careful that you should provide valid JavaScript.

stopAfterCUs.title: Stop after CUs
stopAfterCUs.description: Actor run will finish after reachin certain amount of Compute units.

notificationEmails.title: Notification emails
notificationEmails.description: Emails where should the bellow notifications should be sent.

notifyAfterCUs.title: Notify after CUs
notifyAfterCUs.description: Actor will send notifications on provide email when it reaches provided CUs.

notifyAfterCUsPeriodically.title: Notify every CUs (periodically)
notifyAfterCUsPeriodically.description: Actor will send notifications on provide email every provided CUs reached from last notification.
